verses.verse: Now Jacob<WH3290> saw<WH7200> that there was<WH3426> grain<WH7668> in Egypt<WH4714>, and Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> unto his sons<WH1121>, Why do ye look one upon another<WH7200>?

And he said<WH559>, Behold<WH8085>, I have heard that there is<WH3426> grain<WH7668> in Egypt<WH4714>: get you down<WH3381> thither<WH7666>, and buy for us from thence<WH2421>; that we may live, and not die<WH4191>.
And Joseph<WH3130>'s ten<WH6235> brethren<WH251> went down<WH3381> to buy<WH7666> grain<WH1250> from Egypt<WH4714>.
But Benjamin<WH1144>, Joseph<WH3130>'s brother<WH251>, Jacob<WH3290> sent<WH7971> not with his brethren<WH251>; for he said<WH559>, Lest peradventure<WH6435> harm<WH611> befall him<WH7122>.
And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> came<WH935> to buy<WH7666> among<WH8432> those that came<WH935>: for the famine<WH7458> was in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>.

And Joseph<WH3130> was the governor<WH7989> over the land<WH776>; he it was that sold<WH7666> to all the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776>. And Joseph<WH3130>'s brethren<WH251> came<WH935>, and bowed down<WH7812> themselves to him with their faces<WH639> to the earth<WH776>.

And Joseph<WH3130> saw<WH7200> his brethren<WH251>, and he knew<WH5234> them<WH5234>, but made himself strange unto them<WH1696>, and spake roughly<WH7186> with them<WH559>; and he said unto them<WH370>, Whence come<WH935> ye<WH559>? And they said, From the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667> to buy<WH7666> food<WH400>.
And Joseph<WH3130> knew<WH5234> his brethren<WH251>, but they knew not him<WH5234>.

And Joseph<WH3130> remembered<WH2142> the dreams<WH2472> which he dreamed<WH2492> of them<WH559>, and said unto them<WH7270>, Ye are spies; to see<WH7200> the nakedness<WH6172> of the land<WH776> ye are come<WH935>.
And they said<WH559> unto him<WH113>, Nay, my lord, but to buy<WH7666> food<WH400> are thy servants<WH5650> come<WH935>.
We <WH5168> are all one<WH259> man<WH376>'s sons<WH1121>; we are true<WH3651> men<WH5650>, thy servants are no spies<WH7270>.
And he said<WH559> unto them<WH7200>, Nay, but to see the nakedness<WH6172> of the land<WH776> ye are come<WH935>.

And they said<WH559>, We thy servants<WH5650> are twelve<WH8147> brethren<WH251>, the sons<WH1121> of one<WH259> man<WH376> in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>; and<WH6996>, behold, the youngest is this day<WH3117> with our father<WH1>, and one is not<WH259>.
And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto them<WH1696>, That is it that I spake unto you<WH559>, saying, Ye are spies<WH7270>:
hereby <WH2063> ye shall be proved<WH974>: by the life<WH2416> of Pharaoh<WH6547> ye shall not go forth<WH3318> hence<WH6996>, except your youngest brother<WH251> come hither<WH935>.

Send <WH7971> one<WH259> of you<WH3947>, and let him fetch your brother<WH251>, and ye shall be bound<WH631>, that your words<WH1697> may be proved<WH974>, whether there be truth<WH571> in<WH854> you<WH3808>: or else by the life<WH2416> of Pharaoh<WH6547> surely ye are spies<WH7270>.
And he put them all together<WH622> into ward<WH4929> three<WH7969> days<WH3117>.
And Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> unto them the third<WH7992> day<WH3117>, This do<WH6213>, and live<WH2421>; for I fear<WH3373> God<WH430>:

if ye be true<WH3651> men<WH259>, let one of your brethren<WH251> be bound<WH631> in your<WH1004> prison-house<WH4929>; but go<WH3212> ye<WH935>, carry grain<WH7668> for the famine<WH7459> of your houses<WH1004>:
and bring<WH935> your youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> unto me<WH1697>; so shall your words be verified<WH539>, and ye shall not die<WH4191>. And they did so<WH6213>.

And they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH251>, We are verily<WH61> guilty<WH818> concerning our brother<WH251>, in that<WH834> we saw<WH7200> the distress<WH6869> of his soul<WH5315>, when he besought<WH2603> us<WH8085>, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress<WH6869> come upon us<WH935>.

And Reuben<WH7205> answered<WH6030> them<WH559>, saying, Spake I<WH559> not unto you<WH559>, saying, Do not sin<WH2398> against the child<WH3206>; and ye would not hear<WH8085>? therefore also<WH1818>, behold, his blood is required<WH1875>.
And they knew<WH3045> not that Joseph<WH3130> understood<WH8085> them<WH3887>; for there was an interpreter between them.

And he turned himself about<WH5437> from them<WH1058>, and wept; and he returned<WH7725> to them<WH1696>, and spake to them<WH3947>, and took Simeon<WH8095> from among them<WH631>, and bound him before their eyes<WH5869>.

Then Joseph<WH3130> commanded<WH6680> to fill<WH4390> their vessels<WH3627> with grain<WH1250>, and to restore<WH7725> every man<WH376>'s money<WH3701> into his sack<WH8242>, and to give<WH5414> them provisions<WH6720> for the way<WH1870>: and thus<WH3651> was it done unto them<WH6213>.
And they laded<WH5375> their asses<WH2543> with their grain<WH7668>, and departed thence<WH3212>.

And as one<WH259> of them opened<WH6605> his sack<WH8242> to give<WH5414> his ass<WH2543> provender<WH4554> in the lodging-place<WH4411>, he espied<WH7200> his money<WH3701>; and<WH6310>, behold, it was in the mouth of his sack<WH572>.

And he said<WH559> unto his brethren<WH251>, My money<WH3701> is restored<WH7725>; and<WH2009>, lo, it is even in my sack<WH572>: and their heart<WH3820> failed<WH3318> them<WH2729>, and they turned trembling one<WH376> to another<WH251>, saying<WH559>, What is this that God<WH430> hath done unto us<WH6213>?
And they came<WH935> unto Jacob<WH3290> their father<WH1> unto the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>, and told<WH5046> him all that had befallen<WH7136> them<WH559>, saying,
The man<WH376>, the lord<WH113> of the land<WH776>, spake<WH1696> roughly<WH7186> with us<WH5414>, and took us for spies<WH7270> of the country<WH776>.
And we said<WH559> unto him<WH3651>, We are true men<WH7270>; we are no spies:
we are twelve<WH6240> brethren<WH251>, sons<WH1121> of our father<WH1>; one<WH259> is not<WH6996>, and the youngest is this day<WH3117> with our father<WH1> in the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667>.

And the man<WH376>, the lord<WH113> of the land<WH776>, said<WH559> unto us<WH3045>, Hereby shall I know that ye are true<WH3651> men<WH3240>: leave one<WH259> of your brethren<WH251> with me<WH3947>, and take grain for the famine<WH7459> of your houses<WH1004>, and go your way<WH3212>;

and bring<WH935> your youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> unto me<WH3045>: then shall I know that ye are no spies<WH7270>, but that ye are true<WH3651> men<WH5414>: so will I deliver you your brother<WH251>, and ye shall traffic<WH5503> in the land<WH776>.

And it came to pass as they emptied<WH7324> their sacks<WH8242>, that<WH376>, behold, every man's bundle<WH6872> of money<WH3701> was in his sack<WH8242>: and when they and their father<WH1> saw<WH7200> their bundles<WH6872> of money<WH3701>, they were afraid<WH3372>.

And Jacob<WH3290> their father<WH1> said<WH559> unto them<WH7921>, Me have ye bereaved of my children<WH3130>: Joseph is not<WH8095>, and Simeon is not<WH3947>, and ye will take Benjamin away<WH1144>: all these things are against me.

And Reuben<WH7205> spake<WH559> unto his father<WH1>, saying<WH559>, Slay<WH4191> my two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>, if I bring<WH935> him not to thee<WH5414>: deliver him into my hand<WH3027>, and I will bring him to thee again<WH7725>.

And he said<WH559>, My son<WH1121> shall not go down<WH3381> with you<WH251>; for his brother is dead<WH4191>, and he only is left<WH7604>: if harm<WH611> befall<WH7122> him by the way<WH1870> in which ye go<WH3212>, then will ye bring down<WH3381> my gray hairs<WH7872> with sorrow<WH3015> to Sheol<WH7585>.
